title: Increased ping during primetime hours.
body:
Ongoing issue for two or so weeks. Game works 100% fine (60 ping) or so from Oregon. 

https://gyazo.com/8823ed1f23bf3ca87db61255def02331 (non primetime/no issues)
https://gyazo.com/e06d5470864ec6d7242160972fa86335 (issues 60-180 + ping)

Only occurs during primetime (5PM-1 AM) PDT. 

ISP has responded and stated the following 

https://gyazo.com/7ad2165ef33a50ae96047303b507bb53
https://gyazo.com/6ea057eba393c3f31ca94517830f813f

I'm lost on what do at this point. I'm assuming until their partners fix the issue this will be an ongoing issue. Is there anything I can do that will decrease the packet loss/skips until its fixed?

replies.body:
Appreciate confirmation. I asked about being routed through another source and they said it was worse. Honestly not sure how 180 ping and constant spikes could be worse. Only other option in town is someone with poor reviews and after talking with a tech over the phone he didn't seem like it would be a guaranteed improvement. Or I confused him and as he suggested I use another league server after asking if he could run some trace testing. 

I guess I'll ask a couple shot in the dark questions 

Do you have any information in your database about this ISP (http://residential.wavebroadband.com/the-wave-difference/)  
Would using a VPN  do anything? (Pretty sure no but want to confirm)
How long would you  estimate a fix to occur with their partner? (http://cogentco.com/en/) 

Thanks again

I read through the messages your ISP provided and it definitely looks like the Backbone provider they're partnering with is the source of the issue. I'd be sure to clarify with them that the IP you provided is a test server that we've set up and that it can be used to determine which partner they should route you through. 

Let me know if you have any other questions.
